attributes.action: intervene and stop the deportation of LAURENCE HAKIZINKA and her son, Nathan.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Laurence Hakizinka and her son, Nathan, face imminant deportation from the UK after being taken to a deportation centre earlier this week.

Laurence has been living in Blackburn with Darwen since 2002. As her friends, we have grave concerns both about the way her case has been handled over the years by the Home Office and by her likely imprisonment when she returns to Rwanda. 

We the undersigned wish to register our support for her and Nathan – and respectfully to ask that consideration be given to seeking a review of her case before she and Nathan are required to leave the UK.

rejection.details: We cannot accept petitions of this nature as individual legal cases are a matter for direct communication with the Home Office. Please see our terms and conditions for more information: http://petitions.number10.gov.uk/terms
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
